visualizer

Class Visualizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.application.Application
      • visualizer.Visualizer

  • public class Visualizer
extends javafx.application.Application
    Contains all the methods that handle the Rectangle animation
    Author:
    Andrea

      static void colorRectangles(javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle R, javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle P)
      Given two Rectangles, this method colors both red and then white, so that a comparison between values is "highlighted", and adds the animation to the main SequentialTransition that holds the animation
      static void fillR(javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle[] rectangles, java.lang.Integer HEIGHT, java.lang.Integer WIDTH)
      Fills an array of Rectangles with Rectangles corresponding to the values in an array passed as parameter; The type of the array must be a numeric type with a total order relationship
      static void handleDoubleArray(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> L)
      If the input choice was for Double, this method copied the input to the array used for generating the rectangles in the animation
      static void handleIntArray(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> L)
      If the input choice was for Integer, this method copied the input to the array used for generating the rectangles in the animation

      Returns the state of the current animation, if an animation is running

      Pauses the animation

      Plays the animation

      Prepares the stage and handles the animation part

      static void stopAnimation()
      Stops the animation, sets the rectangles back to their original positions, clears the stats and puts the animation in step-by-step mode
      static void updatePosition(javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle[] A, java.lang.Integer first, java.lang.Integer last)
      Creates a SequentialTransition which contains the animation of the movement of the rectangles to the position they occupy in the sorted part of the array in a particular moment

      • prepareStage

        public static void prepareStage(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
        Prepares the stage and handles the animation part
        Parameters:

      • handleDoubleArray

        public static void handleDoubleArray(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> L)
        If the input choice was for Double, this method copied the input to the array used for generating the rectangles in the animation
        Parameters:
        L - An ArrayList of Double that contains the input for the sort animation

      • handleIntArray

        public static void handleIntArray(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> L)
        If the input choice was for Integer, this method copied the input to the array used for generating the rectangles in the animation
        Parameters:
        L - An ArrayList of Integer that contains the input for the sort animation

      • ArrayMax

        public static <T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>> T ArrayMax(T[] A)
        Returns the max value in an array of Comparable items
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the elements of the array; must extend Comparable interface
        Parameters:
        A - The array of Comparable items
        Returns:
        The maximum value in the array

      • fillR

        public static void fillR(javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle[] rectangles,
                         java.lang.Integer HEIGHT,
                         java.lang.Integer WIDTH)
        Fills an array of Rectangles with Rectangles corresponding to the values in an array passed as parameter; The type of the array must be a numeric type with a total order relationship
        Parameters:
        rectangles - The array of Rectangles to be filled
        HEIGHT - The height of the area in which the values are represented
        WIDTH - The width of the area in which the values are represented

      • colorRectangles

        public static void colorRectangles(javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle R,
                                   javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle P)
        Given two Rectangles, this method colors both red and then white, so that a comparison between values is "highlighted", and adds the animation to the main SequentialTransition that holds the animation
        Parameters:
        R - The first Rectangle
        P - The second Rectangle

      • updatePosition

        public static void updatePosition(javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle[] A,
                                  java.lang.Integer first,
                                  java.lang.Integer last)
        Creates a SequentialTransition which contains the animation of the movement of the rectangles to the position they occupy in the sorted part of the array in a particular moment
        Parameters:
        A - The array of Rectangles to be sorted
        first - The first index of the range over which to "update" the position of the rectangles
        last - The second index of the range over which to "update" the position of the rectangles

      • accessesUpdate

        public static void accessesUpdate()
        Updates the counter for array accesses in the Main class

      • play

        public static void play()
        Plays the animation

      • isPlaying

        public static boolean isPlaying()
        Returns the state of the current animation, if an animation is running
        Returns:
        true if an animation is currently running, false otherwise

      • pause

        public static void pause()
        Pauses the animation

      • stopAnimation

        public static void stopAnimation()
        Stops the animation, sets the rectangles back to their original positions, clears the stats and puts the animation in step-by-step mode
